title: Mastering RAG
description: This workshop will dive deep into the concept of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). Participants will learn how to integrate retrieval-based methods with generative models to improve AI-driven content generation, covering theory, applications, and hands-on implementation.
registration: Only college students are permitted to participate.
A valid college ID is mandatory.
Participants must wear the registration throughout the day.
Prior registration is mandatory to attend any event/workshops, either online or on-spot.
Re-entry is not allowed, and the fee paid for any event/workshops is non-refundable.
rules: Each participant must bring their own laptop with necessary software pre-installed (e.g., Python, relevant libraries).
Participants should have a basic understanding of machine learning concepts and be familiar with deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow).
Active participation is required for coding exercises, and completion of tasks is necessary to gain full benefit from the workshop.
No use of mobile phones, external gadgets, or unauthorized resources during the session.
Respect the workshop instructors and fellow participants. Any disruptive behavior will result in disqualification.
Participants must refrain from sharing or using unauthorized code during practical sessions.
Participants will have the opportunity to ask questions and receive feedback, but must ensure not to disrupt the flow of the session.
The workshop may include a practical coding challenge at the end with potential rewards for the best solutions.
